TopicTitle: Is there a way to remove the Oranges? (Jeb/Bill/Bob)

Articles.Content:
Title says it all. It's a bit boring to see the Orange Suits always hijacking the seats by default. Using a heavily modded client to increase difficulty/realism, and would love to have perma death for them, or not have them available at all.

I've used TAC Life Support's "no respawn" option, but it doesn't seem to affect them. They eventually respawn and hog the seats again. Also, because I'm using life support, stashing them in a pod and letting it sit somewhere isn't very economic, and if I don't get to them before their expiration date, they are restocked.

Any mods/edits to achieve this?

And no, I don't mean remove their orange suits, I call them "Orange Suits" because their suits are, well.. orange.

I was going to recommend crew manifest, but the Version 0.5.5.0 update says they removed permadeath because it was added to the game...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60936

i think you need to edit a file somewhere to turn on permadeath but i'm not sure how.

i remember max saying that the upcoming 0.25 update will include some ingame difficulty options like no reverting missions, and i'm pretty sure he mentioned permadeath. It was in the devnotes somewhere but i can't find it...
Permadeath is now in the Debug menu options. From the Space Center view: Alt+F12 > Gameplay Tweaks > uncheck Lost Crews Respawn.

Real Roster

This allows you to set it so the big 3 never get auto assigned to seat. You can even set it so no kerbals are autoassigned
